structure.unit: ARTICLE II. METROPOLITAN MIAMI-DADE COUNTY MINIMUM HOUSING STANDARDS

law.catch_line: Minimum Housing Enforcement Officer—Office established; appointment; term; exempt from classified service; salary.

text.section:
Sec. 17-7. Minimum Housing Enforcement Officer—Office established; appointment; term; exempt from classified service; salary.
The office and position of Minimum Housing Enforcement Officer is hereby created and established. The Minimum Housing Enforcement Officer shall be appointed by and serve at the will of the County Manager. Such officer shall be chosen by the County Manager on the basis of qualifications and experience in the field of building and housing. The office shall constitute a position exempt from the classified service of the County. The salary for such position shall be fixed by the County Manager, and shall be included in the County budget. The Minimum Housing Enforcement Officer shall serve under the administrative supervision of the Director of Team Metro. The County Manager may appoint such assistants to the Minimum Housing Enforcement Officer as may be necessary in order that the duties may be properly performed, subject to budget limitations.
